FSU Admissions & Enrollment - Becoming a Student
At FSU, empowering your success is our mission.

This is your time to expand your mind and your horizons, to achieve what you've always envisioned and even that which you never imagined. Only at a university like ours can you experience the exceptional faculty support made possible by a commitment to small class sizes and to recruiting professors with outstanding credentials. Expect challenging courses, lasting friendships, and the exhilaration of knowing your life is headed in any direction you want.
Don't just take our word for it. Hear from some of our over 6,000 students.
FSU Admissions & Enrollment - Becoming a Student

The majority of students receive financial aid at FSU. The college experience doesn't have to break the bank!
FSU has 10 undergraduate online degree completion programs. Find a flexible program for you.
FSU holds 35 Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association (CIAA) championships.

We believe in results...and we know how to foster achievement. Whether you're in high school, already working, or transferring from another institution, FSU is a university that inspires you to set high expectations for yourself. And you can bet that we'll expect a lot from you - because we know the possibilities and the payoffs for your future are limitless. We have thousands of successful alumni to prove it. We will be actively involved in making the most of your FSU experience.
With 33 bachelor's degrees, 8 master's degrees, and 1 doctoral degree (not to mention certificates and licensure options)
, Fayetteville State University is ready to provide the next step in your educational career.

Whether you are looking for a well-established university full of rich traditions (we were founded in 1867!), professors who can become mentors (our students consistently mention supportive, knowledgeable professors as one of the highlights of the Bronco experience), or simply something you can't get anywhere else (maybe the only NGA accredited GEOINT program in NC?), we are Proud to Be the University for You!Visit
to find out more about how to apply.
A message from the Office of Admissions:

In keeping with its commitment to free speech and free expression, Fayetteville State University will not disqualify applicants for admission or scholarships solely on the basis of disciplinary actions resulting from participation in peaceful protests.
What stands out about FSU is that we are like a family. You interact with so many different people from different backgrounds. The events we have bring everyone together. It’s a big support system.

Complete your degree from anywhere with Fayetteville State University's Online Degree Completion programs. We offer 10 programs which combine the quality of an FSU education with the flexibility to earn your degree from wherever you are!

FSU's online degree completion programs allow you to complete your upper-division (junior and senior level) courses online. To be admitted to an ODC program, you must already have completed the University College Core Curriculum or be dual enrolled with a partnering community college.

Admission to the university does not guarantee admission to an online degree completion program. Once you are admitted to the university, the academic department will evaluate your credentials for admission to the online program.
An online degree completion (ODC) student takes at least 75% of upper-division coursework online.
Online Degree Completion programs are available in:
For more information about the ODC programs, visit
To be eligible for admission to Fayetteville State University, you must:
be eligible to return to the last institution you attended, and
have attained a cumulative 2.0 GPA or higher based on all courses attempted at all institutions.
Application requirements differ slightly based on your age and whether you have earned an associate's degree. Click below to see what you should submit as part of your application to FSU.
All admission documents can be emailed to admissions@uncfsu.edu or mailed to:
And have 24 or more transferable credit hours (but have not earned an associate's degree)
Your application to FSU should include:
Undergraduate Application through CFNC - select Online Degree Completion
$50 non-refundable application fee (waived for active duty military)
Official transcripts from each college or university attended (Transcripts should be sent directly from your previous institution's Registrar's Office.)
Applicants 21 or older at the time of enrollment
Applicants who have earned an Associate degree
Associate of Science or Associate of Arts degree regardless of age
